0.Pros: Great place to work and nice people to work with. The environment is clean and management do care about you here. Over all it is a good place to work depending on experience.
0.Cons: Dealing with the public and other people that come into the restaurant is not a good part of the job because people are rude. Work life balance is not good, but the establishment still has to run.

1.Pros: Coworkers were nice and sometimes helpful.
1.Cons: rude customers (that's everywhere) short staff , had selfish boss.

2.Summary: "Can be good, if you like part time"
2.Pros: Flexible schedules, great if you like customer service/smiling. I personally have great co-workers and love to go to work!
2.Cons: I can't believe some people they've advanced to Shift Lead or worse Manager... the Peter Principle in effect! Sometimes they hire seriously stupid people, makes the job harder.

3.Pros: It holds amazing opportunities! It is stressful and a lot harder than most think, but it's a great corporation to work for!
3.Cons: Again it's stressful, sometimes hard work goes unnoticed for awhile- if you keep it up you can be at the top in no time!

4.Pros: I love my job McDonald's has always treated me fair I love my customers and the people I work with we are family at work lol
4.Cons: We have to work that's a downer

5.Pros: At McDonalds you learn a lot about things to help you in the future
5.Cons: I do not have any negative comments about McDonalds

6.Cons: customers that don't appreciate you at all

7.Pros: You get to learn how to work with some interesting people.

8.Pros: Easy if you are doing drive through
8.Cons: Rude customers, horrible managers one of which even got drunk during her shift, lots of drama, the smell is horrible, too many customers

9.Pros: One of the pros include the half off discount for food and meeting new people
9.Cons: Theres a lot of favoritism between managers and crew members
